page.title: 01Housing
page.content: There are 150 dwellings in Ecton built mainly of stone and brick. About one third were built before 1900 .Around 20 houses were built as council houses. Some are now owner occupied. Only infilling is now allowed but houses have to be built of stone. Bellinge, Blackthorn, Standens Barn and Rectory Farm have all been built during the last ten years and therefore the property is new. Around Bellinge there are flats, bungalows, terraced houses, detached and semi-detached houses. Most of the property is 2 or 3 storey terraced houses and rented. Great Billing is an old village. Most of the property there is owned. It is quaint with cottages and period properties.
